FuncDef:
The dhcp-user-warning-threshold command sets an alarm threshold for DHCP users allowed to access the entire . If the percentage of DHCP users currently accessing the entire reaches the threshold, an alarm is generated.
The undo dhcp-user-warning-threshold command removes the alarm threshold set for DHCP users allowed to access the entire device.
By default, the alarm threshold for DHCP users allowed to access the entire is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Alarm threshold.
The value is an integer, ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you run this command, if the percentage of the number of DHCP users currently accessing the entire to the maximum number of users allowed to access the entire NE40E reaches the set threshold, an alarm is generated.
A dual-stack user will be counted as both an IPv6 user and an IPv4 user.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
